Skrowaczewski is a Bruckner specialist, and his cycle with the Saarbrücken Orchestra is one of the few absolute references. He conducts the Nullte with a .

Stanisław Skrowaczewski Saarbrucken Radio Symphony Orchestra 2003.11.6 Tokyo Opera City Concert Hall Live. Japan. Skrowaczewski is a Bruckner .

Conductor: Stanisław Skrowaczewski Ensemble: Saarbrucken Radio Symphony Orchestra.

Bruckner's Seventh Symphony may top the list of Bruckner's most important compositions for it was not until its premiere that the composer's symphonic works .

Title: Bruckner Symphony 8 Skrowaczewski live 2016 Berlin
Description:
It was his last visit to Berlin, a Sunday afternoon, April 17th, at the Philharmonie with the Rundfunksinfonie-Orchester Berlin. 
We knew he wanted to come back in two years, but we also knew it might not meant to be. 
It wasn´t.
I think the applause only faded out at last because we didn´t bear to watch him taking the way offstage and onstage again and again. We all saw how difficult these steps were for him. Otherwise we would probably applaude him still. We didn´t want him to go.
But he went, and he will never come back.
If you believe in these things, he might now be with Bruckner, discussing the different editions and interpretations. 
Even if I don´t believe this myself, I like the idea.
Thank you, Stanislaw Skrowaczewski, for all these moments I forgot the world, my madness and all the sorrow around me.

Title: Mozart 38 Prokofiev Romeo Philadelphia Skrowaczewski Apr 1964 Live
Description: First half of a concert guest conducted by Skrowaczewski, who guested frequently in the 1960s and 1970s while music director of Minneapolis, a post that EO had held from 1931-36. (Szell was the first to invite Skrowaczewski to the United States, in 1958.) Taut Mozart and exciting Prokofiev are in this program. The second half, consisting of the Schumann 4 and Firebird suite, is separately posted on this channel.

Title: Schumann 4 Stravinsky Firebird Philadelphia Skrowaczewski Apr 1964 Live
Description: Skrowaczewski leads a Schumann 4 that is exciting and propulsive and full of tension, and a Firebird Suite that is taut and shows off Philadelphia’s spectacular brass to its fullest advantage. He was a terrific conductor, and uses the abundant player talent before him to its maximum effect.

Title: Stanisław Skrowaczewski Concerto for English Horn and Orchestra
Description:
This concerto was written and conducted by Stanisław Skrowaczewski.  He was the long time director of the Minnesota Orchestra.  The soloist is Thomas Stacy.  This LP recording was originally issued on Desto Records in 1971.

The Orchestra performed this piece in Carnegie Hall in 1971.  The New York Times critic who heard the Concerto was less than enthused referring to it as "not modern" and that in the end it was "a mess."  At the same time, he found the performance of the orchestra to be excellent, and praised Skrowaczewski's conducting. Of Thomas Stacy, he said "Stacy must be the Horowitz of the English Horn."

He also noted the rarity of a concerto for the English Horn - saying, "it's as rare as finding fur on fish."

I am posting as part of an effort to share works that are not on Youtube already and that are no longer in print.
